definition: to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning

sentences.english: The observers of such incidents remain under influence of apprehensions and trepidations throughout their lives.
sentences.chinese: 目擊此類事件的人會被憂懼恐慌的情緒影響一生。

sentences.english: I fear thy kisses, gentle maiden ;
sentences.chinese: 嫺雅的少女，我憂懼你的親吻。

sentences.english: Why has China's peaceful rise, however, raised apprehensions?
sentences.chinese: 然而，爲什麼中國的和平崛起引起了憂懼？

sentences.english: I dreaded going over to D hall to be manipulated by prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 我對走進D廳受那些罪犯的擺佈心懷憂懼。

sentences.english: Was grace that taught my heart to fear. And grace my fears relieved.
sentences.chinese: 如斯恩典，令心敬畏，解脫萬千憂懼。

sentences.english: Twas grace that taught my heart to fear and grace that fear relieved.
sentences.chinese: 如斯恩典，令心敬畏，解脫萬千憂懼。

definition: mulberry farming/to grow mulberry for sericulture
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
hard to tell if it's real or sham
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
